Prerequisites: ACG 3111 INTERMEDIATE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING II WITH A MINIMUM GRADE OF C.
Course Description: PROBLEMS IN EXTERNAL FINANCIAL REPORTING INCLUDING BUSINESS COMBINATIONS AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, FOREIGN OPERATIONS, AND PARTNERSHIPS. OFFERED CONCURRENTLY WITH ACG 5205; ACG 5205 INCLUDES  ADDITIONAL LEARNING OBJECTIVES NOT INCLUDED IN ACG 4201. WORK. CREDIT FOR BOTH ACG 4201 AND ACG 5205 IS NOT PERMITTED.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
STUDENT LEARNING OUTCOMES (SLO'S)	
COMPARE AND CONTRAST THE ACCOUNTING FOR AN ACQUISITION OF NET ASSETS AND A CONTROLLING INTEREST IN THE STOCK OF A COMPANY
DETERMINE THE COMPONENTS OF CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS USING THE PRINCIPLES OF CONSOLIDATION
CRITIQUE INTRA-ENTITY TRANSACTIONS AND PREPARE ELIMINATION ENTRIES RELATED TO INTRA-ENTITY TRANSACTIONS
ANALYZE FOREIGN CURRENCY TRANSACTIONS AND FOREIGN CURRENCY HEDGES AND PREPARE APPROPRIATE JOURNAL ENTRIES 
RECONSTRUCT FOREIGN FINANCIAL STATEMENTS INTO US DOLLAR BASED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS UNDER VARIOUS SCENARIOS
DEVISE THE APPROPRIATE ACCOUNTING TREATMENT OF VARIOUS PARTNERSHIP ACTIVITIES AND CHANGES
ADDITIONAL SLO FOR ACG5205: COMPILE A COMPARISON AND CONTRAST US GAAP AND INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS RELATED TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN A RESEARCH STUDY.

TOPICS	
THE EQUITY METHOD OF ACCOUNTING FOR INVESTMENTS
CONSOLIDATION OF FINANCIAL INFORMATION
CONSOLIDATIONS: SUBSEQUENT TO THE DATE OF ACQUISITION
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND OUTSIDE OWNERSHIP
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: INTRA-ENTITY ASSET TRANSACTIONS
FOREIGN CURRENCY TRANSACTIONS AND HEDGING FOREIGN EXCHANGE RISK
TRANSLATION OF FOREIGN CURRENCY FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
PARTNERSHIPS: FORMATION AND OPERATION
PARTNERSHIPS: TERMINATION AND LIQUIDATION
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
